孤孑特立.definition: to be all alone in the world

孤家寡人.definition: one who is cut off from others (idiom); one who has chosen to follow a solitary path; (can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)

孤寡.definition: orphans and widows; to be lonely; loneliness

孤征.definition: to act on one's own; to fight alone

孤拔.definition: Amédée Courbet (1826-1885), a French admiral who won a series of important land and naval victories during the Tonkin campaign and the Sino-French War

孤掌難鳴.definition: It's hard to clap with only one hand.; It takes two to tango; It's difficult to achieve anything without support.

孤沙錐.definition: (bird species of China) solitary snipe (Gallinago solitaria)

孤注一擲.definition: to stake all on one throw

孤男寡女.definition: a single man and a single woman; bachelors; a man and a woman together (typically in a secluded setting)

孤老.definition: solitary old man or woman; regular patron (at brothels)

孤芳自賞.definition: lone flower admiring itself (idiom); narcissism; self-love

孤苦零丁.definition: variant of 孤苦伶仃[gu1 ku3 ling2 ding1]

孤證不立.definition: unacceptable as uncorroborated evidence (in law or in textual criticism)

孤身隻影.definition: lit. a lonely body with only a shadow for company; to be all alone (idiom)

孤軍奮戰.definition: lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom); fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support

孤陋寡聞.definition: ignorant and inexperienced; ill-informed and narrow-minded

孤雌生殖.definition: parthenogenesis (biol. a female reproducing without fertilization)

孤零零.definition: lone; isolated and without help; all alone; solitary

孤魂野鬼.definition: wandering ghosts without living descendants to pray for them (idiom); person who has no family or friends to rely on
